newsitem.title: FRANCE: Belgian minister slams "indecisiveness" on Africa.
newsitem.headline: Belgian minister slams "indecisiveness" on Africa.

text.p: Belgian Defence Minister Jean-Pol Poncelet on Monday slammed what he called the world's chronic indecisiveness in dealing with the crisis created by the presence of Rwandan refugees in Zaire.

"The chronic indecisiveness of the international community on how to intervene in the region of the African Great Lakes has unfortunately not given the West European Union (WEU) a chance to show it was ready to act and that is regrettable," he said.

Poncelet, speaking to the WEU's annual parliamentary assembly, said: "I am convinced that we will be held collectively responsible by our respective public opinions and fellow citizens for this political incapability to adequately respond to the drama taking place in central Africa."

Poncelet explained that the WEU, a defence grouping seen by France, Germany and others as a possible future military arm for the European Union, had identified ways in which it could bring logistics support and training for African forces which could intervene in the area.

Belgium has offered such support but has said it would not send its own troops to join in an armed international humanitarian support mission Canada is to lead but which has not yet got off the ground.
